service-version.name: JBoss on Windows
service-version.description: JBoss 5.1 on Windows JBoss Application Server is the open source implementation of the Java EE suite of services. It comprises a set of offerings for enterprise customers who are looking for preconfigured profiles of JBoss Enterprise Middleware components that have been tested and certified together to provide an integrated experience. It's easy-to-use server architecture and high flexibility makes JBoss the ideal choice for users just starting out with J2EE, as well as senior architects looking for a customizable middleware platform.

ns8:component-version-script.description: JBoss: install JBoss server binaries on Windows using Powershell

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns8:component-version-script.description: JBoss: configure JBoss server on Windows using Powershell
ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Configure JMX credential info, firewall settings and Windows service $JAVA_HOME="$JAVA_INSTALL_DIR"
#$JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$env:JBOSS_NAME_AND_VERSION\jboss-as" $JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$JBOSS_NAME_AND_VERSION" $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR="$JBOSS_HOME\server\$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"
set-location $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\conf\props
# This adds JMX credential info add-content jmx-console-users.properties $JBOSS_JMX_USER=$JBOSS_JMX_PWD
# Add JVM route to server.xml copy $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml.bak (Get-Content $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml) -replace 'Engine name[^`>]*', "$& jvmRoute=`"$JVM_ROUTE`"" | Set-Content $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml
# And, we need to allow for Windows firewall settings netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="Java_In_Rule" dir=in program="$JAVA_HOME\bin\java.exe" action=allow netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="Java_Out_Rule" dir=out program="$JAVA_HOME\bin\java.exe" action=allow
$env:JAVA_HOME=$JAVA_HOME $env:JBOSS_HOME=$JBOSS_HOME
$env:Path="$JBOSS_HOME\bin;" + $env:Path
(get-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_HOME%", "$JBOSS_HOME"} | set-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat (get-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat) | %{$_ -replace "%JAVA_HOME%", "$JAVA_HOME"} | set-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat (get-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME%", "$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"} | set-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat . $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat install
# The Service Name is obtained from inside the service.bat script $serviceName="JBAS50SVC" set-service $serviceName -startuptype automatic

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns8:component-version-script.description: Start JBoss Server as a Windows Service
ns8:component-version-script.script:
# The Service Name is obtained from inside the service.bat script $serviceName="JBAS50SVC" start-service $serviceName
# Check and report status $serviceAfter=Get-Service $serviceName $serviceAfterStatus=$serviceAfter.status write-output "$serviceName is now $serviceAfterStatus"

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: Application Component
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Application component, which is used to indicate what type of component is associated with an application or a service supports.

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Installing Dukes Bank application on JBoss $JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$JBOSS_CONTAINER_NAMEVER" $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR="$JBOSS_HOME\server\$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"
# First stop the service $serviceName="JBAS50SVC" stop-service $serviceName $serviceAfter=Get-Service $serviceName $serviceAfterStatus=$serviceAfter.status write-output "$serviceName is now $serviceAfterStatus"
# Copy the EAR file and the SQL JDBC jar in the correct directories write-output "" write-output "deploying $EAR_FILE file to $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\deploy directory" copy-item $EAR_FILE $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\deploy
write-output "deploying $JAR_FILE file to $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\lib directory" copy-item $JAR_FILE $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\lib

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Configuring Dukes Bank application on JBoss $JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$JBOSS_CONTAINER_NAMEVER" $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR="$JBOSS_HOME\server\$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"
# Now modify the DS template file with the required properties set-location $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\deploy copy-item $JBOSS_DATASOURCE_TEMPLATE jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_DRIVER_CLASS%", "$JBOSS_DS_DRIVER_CLASS"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_USER_NAME%", "$db_user"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_USER_PWD%", "$db_password"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_JNDI_NAME%", "dukesBankDS"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_CONNECTION_URL%", "$JBOSS_DS_CONNECTION_URL"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Starting Dukes Bank application on JBoss $JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$JBOSS_CONTAINER_NAMEVER" $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR="$JBOSS_HOME\server\$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"
# Now restart the service $serviceName="JBAS50SVC" write-output "Restarting $serviceName" start-service $serviceName $serviceAfter=Get-Service $serviceName $serviceAfterStatus=$serviceAfter.status write-output "$serviceName is now $serviceAfterStatus"

ns8:component-version-script.script: \windows\system32\servermanagercmd -install net-framework start "test" /wait "%SQLSRV_EXE%" /extract:c:\sqlsrv /q \sqlsrv\setup.exe /q /action=install /IACCEPTSQLSERVERLICENSETERMS /INSTANCENAME=%INSTANCENAME% /features=sql,ssms /indicateprogress /SECURITYMODE=sql /SAPWD=%SA_PWD%

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script: \windows\system32\net start SQLBrowser \windows\system32\net start "SQL Server (%INSTANCENAME%)"

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script:
\windows\system32
et stop "SQL Server (%INSTANCENAME%)" \windows\system32
etsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="SQL Server" dir=in program="c:\program files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10_50.%INSTANCENAME%\MSSQL\Binn\sqlservr.exe" action=allow \windows\system32
etsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="SQL Server Browser" dir=in program="C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SQL Server\90\Shared\sqlbrowser.exe" action=allow \windows\system32
etsh advfirewall firewall set rule name="Network Discovery (NB-Name-In)" new enable=yes \Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -command set-itemproperty -path "'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10_50.%INSTANCENAME%\MSSQLServer\SuperSocketNetLib\Tcp'" -name enabled -value 1 \Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -command set-service -name SQLBrowser -StartupType automatic

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

prop-type.name: Computed

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: Application Component
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Application component, which is used to indicate what type of component is associated with an application or a service supports.

ns8:component-version-script.script:
set SQLCMD="%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft SQL Server\100\Tools\Binn\sqlcmd.exe"
rem *** Create the Dukes Bank database *** set SQLCMDPASSWORD=%DB_INSTANCE_PASSWORD% %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U sa -Q "CREATE DATABASE %sample_db%" %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U sa -Q "CREATE LOGIN %db_username% WITH PASSWORD = '%db_password%'" %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U sa -Q "ALTER AUTHORIZATION ON DATABASE::%sample_db% TO %db_username%"
rem *** Verify the DB got created *** %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U sa -Q "select name, SUSER_SNAME(owner_sid) owner from sys.databases"|find "%sample_db%"
rem *** Run the DB initialization script *** set SQLCMDPASSWORD=%db_password% set SQLCMDDBNAME=%sample_db% %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U %db_username% -i %initialize_db_script%
rem *** Now set the output property for JDBC URL *** set JDBC_URL=jdbc:sqlserver://%my_server_ip%\%DB_INSTANCE%;databaseName=%sample_db%

props.description: Apache HTTP Server installer
Apache HTTP Server install folder
Apache HTTP Server administrator email address
HTTP port number to proxy to
HTTP port number to serve static content. Leave blank to disable this feature.
HTTP proxy port number
Array of IPs to proxy. Set to ["None"] to disable proxy.
Application server route configuration to apply sticky sessions
Set to YES when load balancing non-Java app servers
Optional property to set which URL context to proxy to Tomat using ajp.
Apache HTTP server configuration file
Apache HTTP server documentation root directory
Enable this when configuring proxy to Tomcat instance that is using AJP. Set to YES or NO.
Optional property of the WAR context to proxy to using ajp on Tomcat.

service-version.name: Apache HTTP Server for Windows
service-version.description: Apache HTTP Server 2.2.22-win32-x86-openssl-0.9.8t The Apache HTTP Server is an open-source HTTP server for modern operating systems including UNIX, Microsoft Windows, Mac OS/X and Netware. The goal of this project is to provide a secure, efficient and extensible server that provides HTTP services observing the current HTTP standards. Apache has been the most popular web server on the Internet since April of 1996.

ns8:component-version-script.description: JBoss: install JBoss server binaries on Windows using Powershell

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns8:component-version-script.description: JBoss: configure JBoss server on Windows using Powershell
ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Configure JMX credential info, firewall settings and Windows service $JAVA_HOME="$JAVA_INSTALL_DIR"
#$JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$env:JBOSS_NAME_AND_VERSION\jboss-as" $JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$JBOSS_NAME_AND_VERSION" $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR="$JBOSS_HOME\server\$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"
set-location $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\conf\props
# This adds JMX credential info add-content jmx-console-users.properties $JBOSS_JMX_USER=$JBOSS_JMX_PWD
# Add JVM route to server.xml copy $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml.bak (Get-Content $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml) -replace 'Engine name[^`>]*', "$& jvmRoute=`"$JVM_ROUTE`"" | Set-Content $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml
# And, we need to allow for Windows firewall settings netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="Java_In_Rule" dir=in program="$JAVA_HOME\bin\java.exe" action=allow netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="Java_Out_Rule" dir=out program="$JAVA_HOME\bin\java.exe" action=allow
$env:JAVA_HOME=$JAVA_HOME $env:JBOSS_HOME=$JBOSS_HOME
$env:Path="$JBOSS_HOME\bin;" + $env:Path
(get-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_HOME%", "$JBOSS_HOME"} | set-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat (get-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat) | %{$_ -replace "%JAVA_HOME%", "$JAVA_HOME"} | set-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat (get-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME%", "$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"} | set-content $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat . $JBOSS_HOME\bin\service.bat install
# The Service Name is obtained from inside the service.bat script $serviceName="JBAS50SVC" set-service $serviceName -startuptype automatic

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns8:component-version-script.description: Start JBoss Server as a Windows Service
ns8:component-version-script.script:
# The Service Name is obtained from inside the service.bat script $serviceName="JBAS50SVC" start-service $serviceName
# Check and report status $serviceAfter=Get-Service $serviceName $serviceAfterStatus=$serviceAfter.status write-output "$serviceName is now $serviceAfterStatus"

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: Application Component
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Application component, which is used to indicate what type of component is associated with an application or a service supports.

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Installing Dukes Bank application on JBoss $JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$JBOSS_CONTAINER_NAMEVER" $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR="$JBOSS_HOME\server\$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"
# First stop the service $serviceName="JBAS50SVC" stop-service $serviceName $serviceAfter=Get-Service $serviceName $serviceAfterStatus=$serviceAfter.status write-output "$serviceName is now $serviceAfterStatus"
# Copy the EAR file and the SQL JDBC jar in the correct directories write-output "" write-output "deploying $EAR_FILE file to $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\deploy directory" copy-item $EAR_FILE $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\deploy
write-output "deploying $JAR_FILE file to $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\lib directory" copy-item $JAR_FILE $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\lib

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Configuring Dukes Bank application on JBoss $JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$JBOSS_CONTAINER_NAMEVER" $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR="$JBOSS_HOME\server\$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"
# Now modify the DS template file with the required properties set-location $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR\deploy copy-item $JBOSS_DATASOURCE_TEMPLATE jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_DRIVER_CLASS%", "$JBOSS_DS_DRIVER_CLASS"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_USER_NAME%", "$db_user"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_USER_PWD%", "$db_password"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_JNDI_NAME%", "dukesBankDS"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml (get-content jboss-ds.xml) | %{$_ -replace "%JBOSS_DS_CONNECTION_URL%", "$JBOSS_DS_CONNECTION_URL"} | set-content jboss-ds.xml

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Starting Dukes Bank application on JBoss $JBOSS_HOME="$JBOSS_HOME_DIR\$JBOSS_CONTAINER_NAMEVER" $JBOSS_INSTANCE_DIR="$JBOSS_HOME\server\$JBOSS_INSTANCE_NAME"
# Now restart the service $serviceName="JBAS50SVC" write-output "Restarting $serviceName" start-service $serviceName $serviceAfter=Get-Service $serviceName $serviceAfterStatus=$serviceAfter.status write-output "$serviceName is now $serviceAfterStatus"

ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns8:component-version-script.script: \windows\system32\servermanagercmd -install net-framework start "test" /wait "%SQLSRV_EXE%" /extract:c:\sqlsrv /q \sqlsrv\setup.exe /q /action=install /IACCEPTSQLSERVERLICENSETERMS /INSTANCENAME=%INSTANCENAME% /features=sql,ssms /indicateprogress /SECURITYMODE=sql /SAPWD=%SA_PWD%

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script: \windows\system32\net start SQLBrowser \windows\system32\net start "SQL Server (%INSTANCENAME%)"

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script:
\windows\system32
et stop "SQL Server (%INSTANCENAME%)" \windows\system32
etsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="SQL Server" dir=in program="c:\program files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10_50.%INSTANCENAME%\MSSQL\Binn\sqlservr.exe" action=allow \windows\system32
etsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="SQL Server Browser" dir=in program="C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SQL Server\90\Shared\sqlbrowser.exe" action=allow \windows\system32
etsh advfirewall firewall set rule name="Network Discovery (NB-Name-In)" new enable=yes \Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -command set-itemproperty -path "'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10_50.%INSTANCENAME%\MSSQLServer\SuperSocketNetLib\Tcp'" -name enabled -value 1 \Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -command set-service -name SQLBrowser -StartupType automatic

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

User name for Dukes Bank database in SQL Server
User password for Dukes Bank database in SQL Server

prop-type.name: Computed

ns6:meta-tag-type.name: Application Component
ns6:meta-tag-type.description: Application component, which is used to indicate what type of component is associated with an application or a service supports.

ns8:component-version-script.script:
set SQLCMD="%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft SQL Server\100\Tools\Binn\sqlcmd.exe"
rem *** Create the Dukes Bank database *** set SQLCMDPASSWORD=%DB_INSTANCE_PASSWORD% %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U sa -Q "CREATE DATABASE %sample_db%" %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U sa -Q "CREATE LOGIN %db_username% WITH PASSWORD = '%db_password%'" %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U sa -Q "ALTER AUTHORIZATION ON DATABASE::%sample_db% TO %db_username%"
rem *** Verify the DB got created *** %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U sa -Q "select name, SUSER_SNAME(owner_sid) owner from sys.databases"|find "%sample_db%"
rem *** Run the DB initialization script *** set SQLCMDPASSWORD=%db_password% set SQLCMDDBNAME=%sample_db% %SQLCMD% -S localhost\%DB_INSTANCE% -U %db_username% -i %initialize_db_script%
rem *** Now set the output property for JDBC URL *** set JDBC_URL=jdbc:sqlserver://%my_server_ip%\%DB_INSTANCE%;databaseName=%sample_db%

props.description: Apache HTTP Server installer
Apache HTTP Server install folder
Apache HTTP Server administrator email address
HTTP port number to proxy to
HTTP port number to serve static content. Leave blank to disable this feature.
HTTP proxy port number
Array of IPs to proxy. Set to ["None"] to disable proxy.
Application server route configuration to apply sticky sessions
Set to YES when load balancing non-Java app servers
Optional property to set which URL context to proxy to Tomat using ajp.
Apache HTTP server configuration file
Apache HTTP server documentation root directory
Enable this when configuring proxy to Tomcat instance that is using AJP. Set to YES or NO.
Optional property of the WAR context to proxy to using ajp on Tomcat.

service-version.name: Apache HTTP Server for Windows
service-version.description: Apache HTTP Server 2.2.22-win32-x86-openssl-0.9.8t The Apache HTTP Server is an open-source HTTP server for modern operating systems including UNIX, Microsoft Windows, Mac OS/X and Netware. The goal of this project is to provide a secure, efficient and extensible server that provides HTTP services observing the current HTTP standards. Apache has been the most popular web server on the Internet since April of 1996.
